common

Class SequentialByteArrayReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.SequentialByteArrayReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteStreamReader, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SequentialByteArrayReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ByteStreamReader
    Performs sequential reading of primitive data types from a byte array.

    Supports reading of signed and unsigned integers, floating-point numbers, and byte sequences with configurable byte order (big-endian or little-endian).

    Since:
    12 December 2025
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SequentialByteArrayReader(byte[] buf)
      Constructs a reader for the given byte array with big-endian byte order.

      Constructs a reader for the given byte array, starting from a specified offset.

        buf - the source byte array
        startIndex - the starting index/position from which to begin reading
        order - the byte order to use
        pfile - the path to the file

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Implementation of close for the byte array reader. Since this reader operates on an in-memory buffer, no system resources need to be released. This method is provided for compatibility with the AutoCloseable interface.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ByteStreamReader
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString()
        Reads a null-terminated string (ISO-8859-1).

        Scans for 0x00 starting from the current position. The pointer is advanced past the null terminator.

        Specified by:
        readString in interface ByteStreamReader
        Returns:
        the decoded string excluding the null terminator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the end of the buffer is reached before a null terminator

        private byte getByte(long position)

      • getBytes

        private byte[] getBytes(long position,
                        int length)
        Copies and returns a sub-array from the byte array, starting from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the index (relative to baseIndex) in the byte array
        length - the total number of bytes to include in the sub-array (must be <= Integer.MAX_VALUE)
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the specified subset of the original array

      • validateByteIndex

        private void validateByteIndex(long position,
                               int length)
        Checks whether the specified position is within the byte array’s bounds. If the position is out of range, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - the relative index from baseIndex (0 means first readable byte)
        length - the total number of bytes to check (must be <= Integer.MAX_VALUE)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is out of bounds

      • remaining

        public long remaining()
        Returns the number of unread bytes remaining in the buffer, relative to the current read position.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes still available for reading

        public boolean hasRemaining(int n)
        Checks if at least the specified number of bytes are available to read.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to check for
        Returns:
        true if n bytes or more remain, otherwise false

      • readValue

        private long readValue(int numBytes)
        Reads a signed long of the specified byte length.
        Parameters:
        numBytes - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the long value

      • slice

        public SequentialByteArrayReader slice(int length)
        Creates a new reader that is a "view" of a sub-section of the current reader. The new reader starts at the current position and has the specified length. 
         Example usage in WebpHandler
        long chunkPayloadSize = reader.readUnsignedInteger();
    
        // Create a restricted reader for just this chunk
        try (SequentialByteArrayReader chunkReader = reader.slice((int) chunkPayloadSize))
        {
            if (chunkType == WebPChunkType.VP8X)
            {
                parseVP8X(chunkReader); // This method cannot read more than chunkPayloadSize
            }
        }
    
        // The original reader is still at the start of the payload.
        // We advance it to move to the next chunk.
        reader.skip(chunkPayloadSize);
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes the new slice should contain
        Returns:
        a new SequentialByteArrayReader restricted to the slice
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the slice exceeds the current reader's bounds
